Package com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest

Class SpecialHttpConfigurations

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest.SpecialHttpConfigurations
  • public class SpecialHttpConfigurations
extends java.lang.Object
    Testing tools for validating that HTTP client logic is correctly applying configuration parameters. The test methods set up a server with a defined behavior, then delegate to a provided test action that is expected to succeed or fail depending on the test conditions.
    Since:
    1.3.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  SpecialHttpConfigurations.Params
      See SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction.
      static interface  SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction
      Implemented by the caller to perform some action against an HTTP server.
      static class  SpecialHttpConfigurations.UnexpectedResponseException
      See SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction.

      SpecialHttpConfigurations()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest.SpecialHttpConfigurations.SocketFactorySingleHost makeSocketFactoryThatChangesHostAndPort​(java.lang.String host, int port)
      Creates a SocketFactory implementation that rewrites all requests to go to the specified host and port, instead of the ones given in the URI.
      static void testAll​(Handler handler, SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
      Runs all of the other test methods with the same client logic.
      static boolean testHttpClientCanBeConfiguredToAllowSelfSignedCert​(Handler handler, SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
      Runs a test to verify that the HTTP client logic in the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction can be configured to accept a specific HTTPS certificate (which in this case is self-signed).
      static boolean testHttpClientCanUseCustomSocketFactory​(Handler handler, SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
      Runs a test to verify that the HTTP client logic in the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction can be configured to use a custom SocketFactory.
      static boolean testHttpClientCanUseProxy​(Handler handler, SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
      Runs a test to verify that the HTTP client logic in the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction can be configured to use a web proxy.
      static boolean testHttpClientCanUseProxyWithBasicAuth​(Handler handler, SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
      Runs a test to verify that the HTTP client logic in the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction can be configured to use a web proxy with basic authentication.
      static boolean testHttpClientDoesNotAllowSelfSignedCertByDefault​(Handler handler, SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
      Runs a test to verify that the HTTP client logic in the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction will fail if it connects to an HTTPS endpoint that has a self-signed certificate, when it has not been specifically configured to accept that certificate.

    • Method Detail

      • testAll

        public static void testAll​(Handler handler,
                           SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
        Runs all of the other test methods with the same client logic.
        Parameters:
        handler - determines what the server should return for all responses
        testAction - a SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction implementation

      • testHttpClientDoesNotAllowSelfSignedCertByDefault

        public static boolean testHttpClientDoesNotAllowSelfSignedCertByDefault​(Handler handler,
                                                                        SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
        Runs a test to verify that the HTTP client logic in the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction will fail if it connects to an HTTPS endpoint that has a self-signed certificate, when it has not been specifically configured to accept that certificate.
        Parameters:
        handler - determines what the server should return for all responses
        testAction - a SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction implementation
        Returns:
        true if successful; false if the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction returned false to indicate that the client does not support this kind of test

      • testHttpClientCanBeConfiguredToAllowSelfSignedCert

        public static boolean testHttpClientCanBeConfiguredToAllowSelfSignedCert​(Handler handler,
                                                                         SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
        Runs a test to verify that the HTTP client logic in the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction can be configured to accept a specific HTTPS certificate (which in this case is self-signed).
        Parameters:
        handler - determines what the server should return for all responses
        testAction - a SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction implementation
        Returns:
        true if successful; false if the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction returned false to indicate that the client does not support this kind of test

      • testHttpClientCanUseCustomSocketFactory

        public static boolean testHttpClientCanUseCustomSocketFactory​(Handler handler,
                                                              SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
        Runs a test to verify that the HTTP client logic in the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction can be configured to use a custom SocketFactory. The test method will provide a deliberately incorrect URI, plus a custom socket factory that rewrites requests to go to the correct URI, to verify that the socket factory is really being used.
        Parameters:
        handler - determines what the server should return for all responses
        testAction - a SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction implementation
        Returns:
        true if successful; false if the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction returned false to indicate that the client does not support this kind of test

      • testHttpClientCanUseProxy

        public static boolean testHttpClientCanUseProxy​(Handler handler,
                                                SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
        Runs a test to verify that the HTTP client logic in the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction can be configured to use a web proxy. The test method will provide a deliberately incorrect URI, plus the host/port of a fake proxy that accepts requests and returns the configured response, to verify that the proxy settings are really being used.
        Parameters:
        handler - determines what the server should return for all responses
        testAction - a SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction implementation
        Returns:
        true if successful; false if the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction returned false to indicate that the client does not support this kind of test

      • testHttpClientCanUseProxyWithBasicAuth

        public static boolean testHttpClientCanUseProxyWithBasicAuth​(Handler handler,
                                                             SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction testAction)
        Runs a test to verify that the HTTP client logic in the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction can be configured to use a web proxy with basic authentication. The test method will provide a deliberately incorrect URI, plus the host/port of a fake proxy that accepts requests and returns the configured response, to verify that the proxy settings are really being used; then it will verify that the fake proxy received the expected authorization header.
        Parameters:
        handler - determines what the server should return for all responses
        testAction - a SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction implementation
        Returns:
        true if successful; false if the SpecialHttpConfigurations.TestAction returned false to indicate that the client does not support this kind of test

      • makeSocketFactoryThatChangesHostAndPort

        public static com.launchdarkly.testhelpers.httptest.SpecialHttpConfigurations.SocketFactorySingleHost makeSocketFactoryThatChangesHostAndPort​(java.lang.String host,
                                                                                                                                              int port)
        Creates a SocketFactory implementation that rewrites all requests to go to the specified host and port, instead of the ones given in the URI. This is a simple way to verify that a given piece of client logic is really using the configured socket factory.
        Parameters:
        host - the hostname to send requests to
        port - the port to send requests to
        Returns:
        a socket factory
